Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Marian H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time spent in the eternal city and part of that enjoyment was due to the comfort and convenience of the hotel. We were close to many major attractions (walking distance to Spanish Steps, Borghese Gardens, Trevi Fountain). The local bus stopped right outside the hotel door, which gave us great access to bus and metro transportation around the city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: aljan303965
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute of our stay in Rome and were very satisfied with the hotel we stayed in, the Eliseo. We loved the location, staff, room and general atmosphere of the hotel and would highly recommend The Eliseo to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: perla010
Reviews.Content: My son went for holidays on Christmas to Rome. He sayed in a triple room with 2 friends at the Eliseo hotel. He told me it was very good, the location was fabulous and everything in the hotel was very satisfying. he would recommend it to his friends

Reviews.Title: “Clean old school hotel great view for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mgbd75
Reviews.Content: Had a nice experience at Eliseo. It is just around the corner from Via Veneto. The hotel is clean, the staff is nice and the room was small-medium. Exactly what we needed. The view from the dining room on the 6th floor is amazing!!! The only disadvantage for us was the location (near Via Veneto), which may be an advantage for others - we hung out in different areas of the city...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: alexandria22
Reviews.Content: Clearly from the reviews, this hotel isn't for everyone. If your priorities are location and value, though, this may be the hotel for you. You can walk most anywhere except the Vatican or Coliseum, and the staff will give you clear instructions to get to those by bus. Also convenient to the subway. Yes, the rooms are small and outdated by American standards; Europeans call that charming. Ours had a balcony overlooking the Villa Borghese gardens. The staff were lovely, and made us great dinner reservations each night.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PFPbrady
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in October. It is a typical rome hotel. Bed rooms small and dark and a little dated. However rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast room is on the 6th floor abnd the views are spectacular. Breakfast was reasonable with a good range if food. The staff were approachable and helpful. Santini the barman is a fun guy and very helpful. The location of this hotel is excellent. 8 mins walk to spanish steps. The metro is 100 meters away and the 116 bus stops just outside and will bring you via the pantheon to the vatican. I stay in hotels on a regular bases and this hotel is really ok.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 505Traveller
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to have to write this review but I felt compelled to do so, as I do not wish for others to be as disappointed as we were. I can only echo the comments of some of the other raters above and it is unfortunate that others have also had such a horrible experience - I honestly hoped the taxi was dropping us off at the wrong hotel, as the entrance to the hotel was dark, dingy and most unwelcoming. This feeling was echoed inside, with terribly old decor and lack of customer service upon arrival. As we were visiting Rome as part of a very special celebration for us, we had booked a four star hotel. However, this hotel does not even deserve one star in my opinion - the first room we were given was tiny, dark, dirty, full of damp and was absolutely disgusting, it made me want to be sick. We complained to Citalia and were moved to a different room - apparently better - yes, slightly larger but still full of dubious stains / mould / worn out to say the least. We suffered an unfortunate event with leaks (reading above, this seems to be a frequent occasion, worryingly!) and were not treated well, having to call the travel company again --- we were offered another room - yes, three moves in one afternoon - supposedly their "best" - still not great, mould patch outside the bathroom, worn out, stained headboard, rips, stains to say the least. Breakfast was dreadful - watered down "juice", not fresh, I could barely eat anything. The coffee was awful, did not taste at all fresh and like Italian coffee should! Staff generally were rude and unhelpful. We were so pleased to check out of this hotel and I hope other people will avoid it like the plague, if they want a decent hotel to return to after the long days out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Susana1812
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It's stylish, well furnished, staff is very kind and, most of all, location couldn't be better. It's about 30 mts from Via Veneto, what else?

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, but sooo old”
Reviews.Author: Ljcalgary
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this hotel got a 4-star rating. I suppose when it was new it would have been a really nice hotel, but that must have been a long-long time ago. It should definitely be a 3-star at best. The staff was not rude, but in their effort to act "posh" and professional, they came across quite rude. The hotel room was very small, and the bathroom was TINY. Our room smelled like it had been smoked in for years even though there was no smoking in any of the rooms. I suppose that's an example of how Italians hate rules. Lastly, the airconditioning in this hotel basically does not work. It's central air throughout the whole hotel, but it could barely cool the room (would cool less than 24degrees or so). We found the location to be decent. We walked to Trevi Fountain(really neat), the Spanish steps(nothing special), and the coleseum, from the hotel. Another positive was the breakfast terrace which had a great view. Boiled eggs were available which was refreshing in Italy. This hotel was quite expensive for it's condition, but relative to the average hotel cost in Rome, it actually wasn't that bad I suppose. Overall, all the hotels in Rome are overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “old with average location”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: i dont like old properties and this one is room looks very very very dated as well as hotel in general have seen better days walking to piazza spagna at least 15 minutes and when returning very step way which isnt good after a long day in the city not a good selection of restaurants nearby (most of them expensive) the only good thing is location of breakfast (average for italy) room which was superb in the last floor with and amazing view of the city

Reviews.Title: “Pluche”
Reviews.Author: PeterSparrow
Reviews.Content: Location 2 minutes to Via Veneto and 20 min to Spanish stairs through Via Sistina. It may have been the pluche and what the Italians so euphemistically call "Pianobar" in the street round the back that aroused images of romantic "Off Veneto" alliences in days long past. Entering room 501 it seemed the smell of all that history was still caught in the carpets, but after opening the doors on the tiny tiny balcony overlooking whatever gardens, my wife and I were as cosy as ever. I would go for the 4 star rating only if I had not visited our friends in a room much larger but clearly in need of urgent - even very urgent - refurbishing. Breakfast on the 6th floor was mentioned by others. May I add the triangle shaped balcony at the end of the lounge where the addicted may enjoy their cappuccino WITH a cigarette. Nice view and as fresh a breeze as on the prow of the Titanic! Life doesn't get better that that (even without Celine Dion)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JillyConQueso
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night before a flight after a long weekend in Sorrento. It is an amazing location right across from the Borghese Gardens and a few blocks from Via Veneto. There are 2 five star hotels on the next 2 blocks. The lobby is small and needs some updating, but check in was very easy and they booked a cab for us to the airport no problem. The room was small and my bedside lamp wouldn't work, but it had a small balcony with a great view of the garden. Tiny bathroom with fuses that blew even with my european hair dryer, but clean and updated. The AC needs work, that is the only thing that would keep us from this amazing location a second time. We slept with the doors open all night and weren't bothered by the noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old hotel in a great part of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Zgolf2000
Reviews.Content: It's an older hotel that could probably use a little decorating upgrade but if you cn get past that Everything else was great. The location is close to all the main attractions and is right off of via Veneto away from the crowds and traffic. Directly out the front door is a bus route that goes back and for forth to the Vatican and right past all of the main attractions (bus 116). The rooms are comfortable and clean, thet bed was new and comfortable. The staff couldn't be more accommodating and friendly (make sure you have a drink with Santino the bartender) If you can get the 5th floor rooms they have small balconies facing Villa Borghese. We loved ite for 6 nights and would return any time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars - probably 20 yrs ago”
Reviews.Author: jonhelo
Reviews.Content: Location: excellent - close to the park & all the basic attractions and a fabulous little pizzeria off of Via Veneto. Bus stop just outside the door, if you prefer pedal to the medal vs. walking blues. Check-in: worked out well, quick and friendly. Got walking or bus line directions every time we needed any help. Rooms and overall interior: all seemed to date back about 15-20 years when the place probably may have gotten the four stars. This concerns pretty much everything around. Carpeting, furniture and so on. Had a little ant problem with our first room but got changed to an antless one. The good thing about the historic touch was the non-high-tech fridge, which we could empty of the hotel products by ourselves and then store our baby foods. One major downside for a family with small kids: no microwave in the hotel - the closest was about 3 blocks away. So heating babyfood was a bit of a challenge if we'd be there at eating hours. All heating was possible only at hotel kitchen, which was available only in the morning: so there we were mixing with the personnel - nice and flexible but still would have wanted preferred a microwave. All in all: next time would probably invest a bit more euros and get a more modern and convenient hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location at Fair price”
Reviews.Author: lanny18
Reviews.Content: Sent 3 nights at the hotel. In great location , 5 minutes walk to spanish steps. Near car rental location and parking and supermarket and shops. 2 minutes to via veneto. Hotel rooms are clean . Furniture in rooms are Ok , beds Ok, just a little to soft for my taste. Good breakfast on 6th floor with great view. Hotel staff was attentive and helpful. Some rooms larger than others depending of location on floor, since hotels building is a triangle, rooms closer to tip of triangle are smaller than rooms closer to elevator. Free wi-fi in rooms. I would recommend this hotel and would come back again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “who allocates the stars”
Reviews.Author: suz015
Reviews.Content: whoever allocates the stars for this hotel would need to go back and have a good look around. This hotel was advertised as a 4 star I would not even rate this hotel as a good 2 star. Very run dowm, walls dirty, stains on the carpet, and very noisy at night. Would not recommend this hotel at all. The only thing about this hotel is that the location was good, within walking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely city.”
Reviews.Author: Portaferry
Reviews.Content: Travelled to this hotel with friends. It is very central to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Hotel is quiet and the only objection I would have is that there is no room service and the bar doesn't open until 5.00 pm. But the friendliness and the kindness of the nicest barman ever made up for this. Silviano (I think that's his name) was a true gentleman and couldn't do enough for you. Hotel is quite dated but bedroom and bathroom were fine. View from the breakfast room is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect quaint hotel in absolute perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel70175310
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the hotel. I had read some scary reviews about it, but they were so helpful. One of my friends actually ended up wanting to stay at our hotel last minute, she actually told them about it when we arrived and they were very helpful and gave us a great room with an extra bed. The decor is very olden times, you honestly feel like you are in Rome for the great experience. The breakfast is amazing! The breakfast room is beautiful and clean with people who ask you what you would like to drink etc. The food encludes all types of breads, cheeses and hams, italian bocconcini which i loved and many other things. The people at the desk are very helpful. Two of the men were of amazing hospitality which i didnt expect because some reviews warned me against it. They suggested places to go and used some of their contacts to get us into great local restaurants at the last minute. They even left us a note with many other bookings available and offered us so many options. The showers are great, we had long warm showers after touring and we had the normal room service available. Very nice and quiet and in perfect location. A walking distance from the Spanish steps which lead you to great shopping areas and theres an area where buses stop right outside the door. Great service, great food and amazing hospitality, perfect location and a comfy bed. Thats all i ask for on a trip! :D

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bonekicker
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the damning reviews of this hotel we were apprehensive about what we would find but since we required 6 single rooms in a central hotel our choice was limited. In fact the hotel was more than acceptable allowing for the general expense of accommodation in Rome. It is a little faded but has a degree of character and is happily not an anonymous 'could be anywhere' hotel. The rooms were well furnished and quiet, the breakfast ample as long as you're not looking for 'full English' and the service efficient and pleasant. The only small complaint might be the rather sporadic opening hours of the bar but since it's right beside the Via Veneto that's not a big issue. Generally we had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninIL
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but in this instance I felt it would be unfair not to warn future travelers. This was the worst value hotel I have ever stayed at and can not imagine how on earth it was given four stars. The mattresses were awful, old, cheap and incredibly uncomfortable. Everything in this hotel is at least 30 years old from the tv to the carpets and it was borderline repulsive. I am sure someone's palm was greased to get the four star rating as it is a 2 star at best. Travelers would be better off staying at a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: AndyDevonUK
Reviews.Content: Booked with Citalia who said that it was Four Star. It was worse than anything i have ever stayed in. On arrival the entrance is small, dark and dirty. The first room is was put in was filty. i was then moved next door. The wallpaper was torn, the lamps were falling off the wall, and shower was not attched to the wall. During the night the air conditioning broke and dripped leaving a large puddle on the floor. Ask to be moved again but said could not do it until morning. They then fixed it the followinbg day only for it to happen again. Sued Citalia on return and got money back. Breakfast room has fantastic views - and the worse breakfast ever. Only good point is the position.

Reviews.Title: “Not as billed”
Reviews.Author: mamofour
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my family, young children and grandparents. We chose this hotel because of the location and because it was billed as a concierge hotel that had a great service. The service was spotty. Some desk attendant were great and helpful. Others simply watched as my elderly mother tried to navigate the tiny lobby etc.... the WORST was the first night. It was my husbands birthday and I asked for a recommendation. I think the desk clerk got a kickback but they recommended a tour that would be "perfect" for us....Our party consisted of four small children including a less than 2 year old and an 80 year old with a wheelchair.....the tour was a bus tour that was too long, entirely too expensive and included a 30 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. We quickly lost faith in the concierge service. My mother said it was the worst hotel she had ever stayed in. Location is good but I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “its not worth a 4 star hotel, it should be 1 star”
Reviews.Author: nooz83
Reviews.Content: we booked for the largest room as honeymoon VIP couples, the room was big but full of ants, they changed our room to a smaller room which was smelly, old, bad air condition, they didnt even apolagize, or treat us as VIP, they were not frindly, breakfast was not worth the money , the location and the view which made it worth 1 star

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent view from 6th floor breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: GoWolfpack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an off the beaten track little gem. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful (and gave a great restaurant recommendation) and the breakfast room on the 6th floor has a great view of the Vatican. Across the street is the old city wall so the hotel is relatively quiet. Our room (which was a suite) was good sized but some of the others I saw looked tiny. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in room 501. Small, old, dirty and...”
Reviews.Author: ejmjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 501. Small, old, dirty and unacceptable for the price. Even the coffee was bad. This am was awakened by horrible septic smells in the bedroom. When we arrived 2 days ago neither bedside lamp worked (got new bulbs) the wallpaper is torn and the one real seat has no light to read by and is on it's last legs. Our room looks nothing like the ones on their website, nor does the downstairs. All in all I would not stay here again nor would suggest anyone else based on my experiece.

Reviews.Title: “Its A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel1805
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked a three night stay at the Hotel Savoy, a lovely 4 Star Hotel in a great section of Rome off the Via Veneto. When we arrived we were told that there was some computer glitch, and they had to move us to another hotel for one of the three nights. The Hotel Eliseo (the same price of 180 Euros) as The Savoy, a few blocks away, was really a dump. Perhaps all the other rooms were palatial, but ours was ridiculous. Smelly, mildewed, dark, two lumpy twin beds, an unhelpful staff. Fuggedabotit!

Reviews.Title: “Not dirty, but tired, grubby, and slowly sinking....”
Reviews.Author: ASimpsonCanada
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to this property in 4 years, it's sinking steadily. Badly needs a refresh, room cleaning is superficial, and things like light switches haven't been cleaned since the day they were installed. Breakfast staff cut from two to one person with the result that breakfast service has simply disintegrated. But for the money it's decent enough - we did come back twice, though this is our last visit. Our last night after a long day in Rome there was no water in the hotel. We were facing a 15 hour flight home the next day, but were assured there'd be water the next morning. There wasn't. At 7:00 a.m. we packed, skipped breakfast, checked out immediately and were presented a full bill. Uh no, insisted on refund of the last night. We checked into the Hotel Splendide down the street for 3 hours so we could at least have showers and working toilets. Cost was €90 more per night, but the difference in the property was dramatic. If you're on a budget, then better to book some hotel removed from the center but near a subway station rather than tolerate the Eliseo simply for its admittedly superb location. It takes about 10 minutes to walk from the Spanish Steps to the Eliseo, time which could be spent traveling to some hotel that cares about its property. We don't know if other hotels in this chain are the same, but we're not going to try to find out. Would you?

Reviews.Title: “old but good & clean”
Reviews.Author: montehristo
Reviews.Content: old but clean hotel in a beautiful location very good service nice breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Glorious View of Rome”
Reviews.Author: BethC1
Reviews.Content: In addition to very pleasant accommodations, the Hotel Eliseo boasts a spectacular sunset view from the balcony of its 6th floor dining room. My husband and I stayed there on our honeymoon and were awed by the sunset over St. Peter's Basilica on the last evening of our stay. Also, the hotel is within comfortable walking distance of the Spanish Steps and the Pantheon, and metro access at the end of the block opens the whole city up to you easily.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, very good hotel for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: FreeTravelerBG
Reviews.Content: After our previous stay in Rome (at 2007 in 3 star Hotel Canova on Via Urbana), we had no great expectations about the Hotel in Rome. Therefore when our agency offered to us a few hotels, we chose the 4 star Eliseo because of its location. Of course, we read the reviews in Tripadviser, and they helped us to choose Eliseo Hotel. Indeed, the location of the Hotel is superb – very close to Borghese Park, near to the corner of Via Vitorio Venetto, only 5-10 minutes walk from the Spanish steps, 15 minutes from di Trevi. The breakfast is on the 6th floor, from where was a gorgeous and unforgettable panorama to the Vaticana, Cathedral Saint Peter, The Castle of Saint Angelo and the Borghese Park. The rooms were clean and spacy for the standards of Rome, the staff was gentle and ready to help and assist with anything – calling a taxy, helping you with an umbrella etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel In Rome, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: orlandotourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed ot the Hotel Eliseo in Rome on the last stop of our European vacation. After a horrendous train ride on the Artesia Night train from Paris (four hours late getting into Rome) we were not disappointed with the Hotel Eliseo. Indeed, it was better than we expected. The check in was easy, and the front desk people were very heplful with any questions we had. The rooms were spacious and very clean, and overlooked an ancient wall of the Villa Borghese. The room had a safe, and minibar, ironing board with iron. The large marble bathroom has a hair dryer and was very nice. The service of the room was outstanding while we were there. The airconditioning was very good. The morning breakfast on the top floor has a wonderful view over Rome, and is very well decorated, like eating in a very nice resturant. The buffet had a variety of cheeses, meats, cereal, pastries, fruit, bread, juice and coffee/tea. It was a great way to start the day. The service for the breakfast area was very good. The location was great for us. There are many restuarants within a few blocks, and about five blocks from The Spanish Steps where there is a Metro station. This made getting to The Vatican and Coloseum quite easy. There are many restaurants near the Spanish Steps as well, and the Trevi Fountain is not much futher on foot. The area for sitting off of the lobby is large, and has a full bar there. The man tending the bar will serve drinks and snacks to anyone in the sitting area. The only drawback was wifi had to be accessed from the sitting area for a price. A card with an access code could be purchased at the fron desk. It wasn't to bad; I think a few euro for a few hours? It served well for checking email and seating on our return flight home. We ate at several great Italian restaurants while there; they are everywhere. The Hard Rock Cafe is only a few blocks from the hotel; had Father's day dinner there. We did guided tours of The Vatican and Vatican Museums, Palatine Hill and The Forum/Coloseum. We finally settled on Through Eternitiy Tours for all. The guides were outstanding, and the service provided made our experiance in Rome everything we hoped it would be. Hotel Eliseo provided us with a great place to stay in Rome, wonderful breakfast, and the highlight on our final destination of this memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Eliseo hotel”
Reviews.Author: LinaS1
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel of 4 stars, close to Piazza di Spagna and to the Trevi fountain, so it is in a very nice and convenient place and I could hear no noise when I was in the room. Via Veneto (street) is around the corner of the hotel where thare are nice restaurants and shops. The breakfast was perfect (maybe the variety was not great but everything was fresh and very tasty) and the view from the floor where the breakfast is taking place, is breathtaking. The room was clean but small regarding the price of it. But in Rome you can not expect very good standards in hotels as in London par example. In addition there are little buses outside of the hotel where they can take you to Vatican or to other places in Rome for 1-2 euros.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: claire35_9
Reviews.Content: it was so difficult checking out hotels available, and trying to pick a good one... however, we scored well with this one. The room was very comfortable, had everything you needed for a short break. breakfasts were good, staff were friendly and helpful, and location was fantastic. views were amazing- could see the spanish steps, the vatican from our balcony. Awesome. would recommend this to a friend, and would return to this hotel for a future break. Rome is such a beautiful city- we were only there for 3 nights- not long enough, but we managed to cram alot in. Wear comfy shoes- thats a must! Rome is expensive- and we did get ripped off a tad here and there- which was to be expected so no real surprise. however we did find a lovely wee italian deli, and got two bottles of vino- for 5 euros, and they were lovely- no worse than wine we paid 24 euros in restaurants!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Old Hotel - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: CO_MaryJo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eliseo for a week in a lovely 5th floor room with a balcony. The room was large by European standards. The breakfast every morning was wonderful with a good selection of cheese, meat, breads, fruit, yougart, juice and coffee served in a lovely room full of windows with a view of the Borghese park and the Vatican. (If you are a coffee snob, you will find the coffee below your standards.) This hotel was less than half the price of staying near the Pantheon. It is a great value. The staff is extremely helpful and welcoming. The location is great. You are away from the hustle/bustle of Rome, across the street from a wonderful park and just a short walk to the Spanish Steps. There is a close subway stop and (don't miss this please!) a very convenient little electric bustop across the street from the hotel. This bus will ride you into the interior of Rome where all the tourist attractions are located - The Piazza Del Fiori, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain - and the electric bus runs later than the subway. This is my 2nd stay here and I plan to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here it will ruin your Rome experience”
Reviews.Author: ItchyTasmania
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel in June 2009 with my husband and daughter. We all described it as "Fawlty Towers". The location was convenient but that is the only good thing to be said. The decor is very very tired and the room looked, felt and smelt unclean. The sheets did not fit the bed. The first roll of toilet paper was not replaced in our four night stay until in desperation I used my Italian dictionary to write a note to the cleaning lady and left it in the bathroom. Showering was a two person effort as one person had to hold the shower whilst the other washed. At breakfast the coffee came from a machine and was the worst we had drunk in Italy. Worst of all, I was attacked by BED BUGS and the resulting severe itchy rash and welts ALL OVER my body ruined my time in Rome as I felt seriously ill from the bites, welts, rash and side effects for the entire duration of our stay there including on the way home and afterwards. DO NOT STAY here.

Reviews.Title: “Past Glory”
Reviews.Author: scottieStAnnes
Reviews.Content: A good location, just a short downhill walk to the central areas, the Via Veneto is just around the corner & the Villa Borghese Park just over the road. Our room on the top floor was very nice with a balcony & great views over Rome. I doubt there is much of a view from lower floor rooms due the tall trees lining the road outside the hotel. The reception & bar staff were very polite & helpful. Based on the above I would recommend this hotel, however, the breakfast was poor, very limited in choice & nothing cooked. The service from the waiting staff was indifferent. The hot drinks were from a machine, only one for the whole breakfast room, so you'll queue for a hot drink. No fresh tea or coffee. Hardly 4*!! (There isn't a restaurant at this hotel.) The decor of the common parts was also in need of smartening up. This was once a top hotel it isn't now. Quality has gone in exchange for mediocrity.

Reviews.Title: “Great location old decor serves it purpose”
Reviews.Author: Jandothunder
Reviews.Content: DJANDO NY, NEW YORK April 17, 2009 Planning our first trip to Rome was not an easy task. Our party of 9 needed to book 3 rooms for easter week for 8 nights. I found the hotel on the internet and contacted them by phone. Marchello answered answered the phone and could not have been any nicer. He offered us a special rate and confirmed via fax. The rooms were set up according to our requirements. The rooms were old but very clean which is very important to us. The rooms were decent size although if you plan on spending alot of time in the room there is only one chair in each room. Nice size closet with an electronic safe inside, small refrigerator and flat screen tv. The bathroom was fairly new and very clean with a provided hairdryer. The hotel hasa/c although it was not turned on yet. We stayed on the 4th floor which is the only floor that has balconies facing the front of hotel. With the door open at night for fresh air it was a nice quiet area for sleeping with little road noise. The location was about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the trevi fountain, spanish steps and the pantheon according to your pace. There are buses across the street that can take you to the vatican and the collisium for 1 euro, and the subway is just down the street. The breakfast room was a nice way to get your day started with a nice view of the city although the food was the same every day. Overall our stay was very nice. We used the hotel as a place to crash and recharge our batteries from being out all day and night. The staff of marchello and claudio were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & good location”
Reviews.Author: star498
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Eliseo, Rome with my boyfriend. On arrival to the Eliseo, we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who told us everything we needed to know re breakfast, surrounding sights etc and were provided with various leaflets and maps to assist. The lift was very small, as per previous reviews on here but we were only on the first floor so didn't really need to use it that often. On entering our room, we were taken aback, it was very roomy and very nice, the decor was pleasant and there was more than enough room for the both of us and suitcases. However, there was a strong smell of cigarette smoke which we could not get rid of despite leaving the window open. The bed sheets and towels were replaced every day which was good and the room was very clean. We also had a safe in the wardrobe which was handy. With regards to breakfast, we found this on the 6th floor, a lovely big room with magnificent views over the surrounding areas. Breakfast was on from 7am to 10 am and on one of the days we didn't get up there until 9.45 and were surprised that there was still a lot of food out and it was being replenished regularly despite there being a lot of people there. There was a vast amount of bread, juice, yoghurts, meat, cheese, fruit, tomatoes, eggs and croissants and a hot drinks machine. There was always plenty there. The mini bar was very cheap which was good and this was payable on departure. We found drinks in Rome very, very expensive so we reverted to the mini bar on quite a few occasions and it was definitely a lot cheaper. Unfortunately, we did not get chance to try the hotel bar as it appeared to be closed everytime we went past. The Eliseo is in a very good location and you can get to most of the sights by foot- we found that the excursions were very expensive and as long as you have a comfy pair of shoes on you can get to most of the sights- spanish steps, trevi fountain are not far from this hotel. Be careful though if you are venturing down the spanish steps, I slipped down them one morning and badly bruised my elbow due to either rain the night before or possibly being washed down. Also, be careful at night, there are lots of people hanging around the spanish steps mithering you for money and they are difficult to get away from! Also there are a lot of people standing outside restaurants enticing you in, just ignore them. We went to various restaurants and cafe's but the most memorable was Harry's Bar- you must visit this place- very, very expensive may I warn you so make sure you have a lot of money with you- we had only 2 mains and a bottle of wine and it came to 114 euros!! Service is fab and decor is gorgeous and there is no one outside here enticing you to go in. Also, the piano bar was very nice, but drinks were extremely expensive- steer clear unless you have money to burn- 12 euros for a pint of beer and 15 euros for a cocktail and it was empty but staff were very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear if possible!”
Reviews.Author: Annie6394
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from almost a week in Rome, somewhere I've always wanted to visit. The city is amazing, everything I could have hoped for, the hotel however very much not. There were three of us away and we arrived early evening to a room with the wrong number and layout of beds, we notified the clerk on the desk and were told that there was nothing they could do until the next morning and we would just have to make do for a night, not great but ok it's late and we were exhausted. We moved into a different room the next day which seemed fine on the intial glance round but on a more detailed look discovered we had a lovely infestation of ants that were happily crawling around the skirting of the entire room, this meant we spent the week living out of suitcases so as to avoid transporting any of them back home! The desk was made aware of the problem on the same day and nothing was done, we reminded them the next day and still no resolution, we stayed from the Sunday until the Friday and nothing was done about the ants the entire time, the only comment made was that they sometimes get in from the outside even though the largest group seemed to be getting through an internal wall! The only positives I can come up with for this hotel is the breakfast room on the sixth floor, looks right over the park and on a clear day you can see a good portion of the city, also the location at the top of the Vio Veneto is good so long as you don't mind a bit of a walk to get to the major attractions. This is definitley not a hotel worthy 4*, infact I would rate it closer to a 2*. Avoid the resaurant recommended by the hotel if possible, worth a ten-fifteen minute walk to the spanish steps for a far superior meal for the same cost, similarly don't book your taxi back to the airport through them, it will cost you fifteen euros more than if you walk round the corner to the taxi stand. When I go back to Rome I will most definitely not be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “no way 4*”
Reviews.Author: davadel
Reviews.Content: i was very dissapointed with this hotel there is no way it is a 4* more like a 2* very tatty, dirty walls and dirty paintwork. they would not provide an iron as it was against the regulations and the bar was shut on sundays so you couldnt even get a cup of tea we were glad to leave

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In the Heart of Rome! Easy Walk to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: RobLibertyOnThePark
Reviews.Content: As a first timer to Rome, I found it very confusing to know where to stay. Everything always sounds great! However, the more I thought about it, the more I realized I wanted to stay in the center of Rome, and after a lot of research, using Tripadvisor and other sites, I chose the Hotel Eliseo, which is at the top of Via Veneto. The hotel was fabulous! The people at the front desk spoke English and were always very pleasant answereing any and all questions with lots of suggestions. The room was large with a queen bed, bedside cabinets for storage, large wardrobe-closet with built-in drawers, in-room safe, desk, chair, sofa chair, very nice bathroom with shower, a/c, small refrigerator/bar and television. The location was fantastic! It was no more than a 15 minute to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain or the Pantheon. It was a little longer walk, but nonetheless, very easy and pleasant to the Colosseum. The Villa Borghese Gardens was just a few minutes away from the hotel. And if you not up for walking, there's a bus stop right across the street from the hotel. The hotel has a very large and comfortable lobby. There's an "American Bar" for early evening drinks. There's plenty of comfortable chairs and sofas. There's a large television and also public Internet available for rent. Hotel Eliseo has a great location and is in very good condition, but it's best feature is their breakfast room which is on the top floor of the hotel, i.e. their rooftop! You'll enjoy a lavish breakfast with lots to choose from while you have panoramic views of Roma! What a great way to start the day! I loved having breakfast here and this feature combined with the location and other hotel amenities makes Hotel Elesio a winner!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: highlanderUll
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on edge of park with views across to Vatican. Very friendly and helpful reception. Gret breakfast room on top floor looking over park. Very close to Spanish steps and local restuarants. Upgraded our room simply because one was available.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: HappytripperLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Eliseo and enjoyed it very much. Room was medium sized, not exactly glamorous but clean. Lack of drawer space for 2 people. Very firm beds (twins bolted together). Double glazing and internal plus external shutters, nets and very heavy curtains made for a dark & very quiet night. Great bathroom with very good shower, though no bath. Fully functioning and seemingly brand new electronic safe in wardrobe. Breakfast was an 8 out of 10; 3 different meats, 2 cheeses, hard boiled eggs, fruit, bread and warm pastries. Would agree with previous reviewers that the 116 bus is brilliant and goes all the way through the back streets to Camp d'Fiori, then the river. The night version runs til 1.30am. Whilst the Metro entrance is very near the hotel the actual platforms are not, so it's quite a walk via the subway - but there is a useful supermarket en route. There are more central hotels but we enjoyed the park and would say the rates are excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireBeeves
Reviews.Content: We were a little cautious about the Eliseo after reading some of the more negative reviews on this site. However, we found the room clean and spacious and the hotel staff unfailingly friendly and eager to help. The hotel is in a great location for visiting places like the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain- it's also right next to the Villa Borghese which is gorgeous and offers a bit of a relaxing haven after some of the more frenetic tourist traps of central Rome in (an extremely hot) August.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ant&Dec
Reviews.Content: Just bak in Ireland after five nites at the Hotel Eliseo and loved it. We had orginally booked Hotel Edera but we were upgraded on arrival. It is a fab hotel and in the best location in the city. The staff were very helpful (especially my fav barman Santino). The roof-top breakfast room was just perfect. Highly recommended for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Does not warrant 4*”
Reviews.Author: Bicyclemadefortwo
Reviews.Content: Great location not to be beaten but does not deserve 4* status. Think opulent but very worn out. Suggestion to hotel - install shower screen in suite on 4th floor and it would be an excellent bathroom. Prices in bar are outrageous and while the bar tender is helpful beware; on his suggestion we went to a restaurant closeby and were totally ripped off! Perhaps we were guillible to take the waiters suggested wine but I really think it was dishonest not to let us know in advance that it cost 40euro a bottle!! Breakfast is ok but dont leave it till the last minute as you'll have to wait for a table and there'll be little choice left. Staff are aloof and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: lizandian
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny compared with other 4 star hotels we had stayed in -the decor was old fashioned, the carpets throughout the hotel needed replacing, the reception staff officious and unwelcoming, the breakfast poor and the atmosphere in the bar non existant (as were other people) The room had a funny smell when we first arrived, and the balcony which we had requested was all of 2 sq ft. There was no safety deposit box in the room, and when we used the one in reception we were made to feel this was an intrusion, with the result that we carried most of our money around with us and only left our passports in the box. Definitely would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so thrilled with the Eliseo...”
Reviews.Author: llamafarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently for four nights. A number of other reviewers have commented on the VERY small size of the rooms and they're not exaggerating. Even for a city hotel in Rome, these rooms are small. But they're huge when compared to the ludicrously cramped little lift that we had to use - the main one (only marginally larger) was out of order for most of our stay - not easy with suitcases (no help offered) or, indeed, if a guest was generously proportioned! And the stairs are very steep....the location is ok, but be warned that although the nearest metro stop is the Piazza Spagna and the entrance to the station is just round the corner, it's a very, very long walk underground to the actual station. Don't try to emerge at the Via Veneto exit as this brings you out into rather deserted scrubland which, when we were there, also featured a rather dubious guy loitering with some kind of intent or other which had nothing to do with improving international/Italian relations.... The walk to the Spanish Steps is about half a mile downhill...but be warned when you come back, it's all uphill. The local restaurants are rip-off joints and excessively over-priced. All in all, this hotel is just about ok for a very short stay but I'm sure there are much better establishments that provide not only better accommodation and facilities, but are also located in more convenient places!

Reviews.Title: “OK but does not deserve as a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: isatam
Reviews.Content: Expected much nicer and better facilities considering it is a 4 stars hotel. However, my boyfriend and I were quite disappointed once we stepped into the hotel lobby, not only it is a bit old but also some in room facilities did not function well, for example, the air-conditioning did not work (only warm air), we had a dreadful night of sleep in a hot roman summer night. Good point is you can get better choice of food for breakfast with a manificient roof garden view of the eternal city. Would not recommend to go unless u cannot find a better hotel deal in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cool welcoming, good location, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, walkable to just about everything in Rome. Fun to take evening strolls down to the Spanish Steps and many restaurants, or along the Via Veneto. Suggest a stroll in the Borghese Gardens right across the street (outside the walls) on a nice afternoon to escape the hustle and bustle of your Roman adventure. The hotel was clean and neat, albeit in need of a little updating. Our rooms were clean and relatively spacious, with sitting areas (as requested). Bathrooms were large and clean. Our welcoming was terrible. No offer of assistance with luggage, and the desk porter barely said hello when we were checking in. We were tempted to change hotels based upon our first impression of the service, but that night met the very friendly and warm bartender, Santino, who saved the day! (Ask him to take you up to the rooftop restaurant terrace at night to see the lights of Rome). Breakfast up there was nice, albeit food was less then sensational. We would consider staying at the Eliseo again (price was right!), but would have no expectation of friendly service. Request rooms on upper floors. Our rooms on level one (Up one floor from ground floor) were noisy with the windows open, and since there was no AC, and the Roman days and evenings were warm while we were there, being a floor or two up higher would have probably been nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wiev”
Reviews.Author: 60yarsofage
Reviews.Content: I was a bit sceptic before my staying, having read the rewievs on this page, but I was pleasently surprised. The room was above average considering the fact that the travel agency had not specified that we wanted twin beds; the double bed was changed within a few hours to two separate beds, but this made the room a bit smaller. The staff was very helpful, kind and friendly - always a smile on the face. And the breakfast room!!! the wiev on a sunny morning was more than I could dream about - so thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, helpful staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: texas11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only 1 nt. on our way to Tuscany, but were pleasantly surprised. I believe some are misled by the 4* rating and are expecting more from this hotel, but you need to consider the location near Via Veneto - very upscale and clean area. Probably in another area it would be a 3 1/2*. In saying that, my sister, father and I were pleased with all aspects of the hotel. Our front desk Manager, Marcello (hope I'm remembering correctly?) was very helpful in answering our questions abt. getting around Rome, and told us abt. the bus that is directly across the street from the hotel, that offers an on/off system for a certain amt of time, for only 1 euro! That saved us a lot of cash we didn't want to spend on a big tour, since we were limited on time and wanted to "roam Rome" on our own. Room (triple) was smallish, but pleasantly decorated and CLEAN. We asked for a quiet room and got it! We had trouble finding a take-out tea (restaurants don't have styrofoam cups!) for my Dad who stayed back in the room in the evening, so upon returning to the Eliseo around 11:00 p.m. asked abt. getting one in the hotel. No problem, was delivered in less than 10 minutes, piping hot! View from rooftop Breakfast Room was magnificent! I'm guessing we were lucky, after reading some negative reviews abt. the food there, but we had a delicious and plentiful breakfast - my Dad (who is very picky), commented it was the best breakfast the whole trip! Restaurants on the Via Veneto are expensive, but there is one around the corner from the hotel (Coyote), that is reasonable and the food was good. Prices are less expensive down on the Piazza Navona. Would stay at this hotel again, for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Shule
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night at Eliseo hotel in Rome. I may agree with others that it is not a four star hotel. However, the location is great, it is in a quiet street, and it has some special atmosphere. Bear in mind that hotels in Via Venetto are highly expensive so this hotel offers rooms for reasonable prices. I am not a demanding traveller and I used most of my time to enjoy Rome so I was satisfied with my room. However, it was rather small. Bathroom was nice, but you can hardly fit into the shower. Breakfast was fine although the service was poor - my impression was that lacked staff so poor lady did not manage to serve everyone. Receptionists were OK, somewhat cold and over proffesional. Definitely, you should expect more comfort in a for star hotel but you may be satisfied if you do not expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “4 star price, 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. We booked 2 rooms both were as bad as the other, before going read other peoples reviews and was open minded as some people would complain that the sky is blue!!. However totally agree, it is not a 4 star, no room safes, rooms were shabby and poorly furnished. My sons room the air con did not work, the hotel has a bar which is shut on a sunday because the guy has a day off. Asked for an iron, which we were given along with an ironing board and had to transport them ourselves to our room on the 5th floor, lovely!! The breakfast room is pleasant with good views over the city, but pot of tea arrived with no lid, hardly 4 star material.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel in September and enjoyed it very much.Yes, it is an old hotel, and as such, tends to be full of nooks and crannies but it does have character.We had an attic room up a tight spiral staircase and it was a bit gloomy but spotlessly clean, had a sitting area and it had a balcony with great views over Rome and of St.Peters in the distance. We thought the hotel was very good value for money, quiet at night and in a very good semi residential area.The location could not be better, if you want a bus they stop outside but we walked everwhere from the Hotel with ease.We have to say that the slog back up via the Spansh Steps after a long day sight seeing was hard work, so we often took the lesser gradient via the Via Vento.The staff at the hotel were courteus and helpful and the breakfasts were good.The views from the breakfast room over Rome, mirrored those from our balcony- fantatsic. You have to take what you pay into consideration when judging a hotel,the Eliseo is a mid price hotel and worth every penny. We would recommend it for its quiet location , freidliness and accesablity to all of Rome's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was a real let down. Definately not 4 star, although room clean and staff OK. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but def. not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the rooms are very poor (small with a terrible bed!!). A bit dissapointing..

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay in the Eliseo Hotel, Rome. We were extremely disappointed with the quality, no way is this a 4* hotel. The hotel requires a COMPLETE overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Best location. Best breakfast. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb for the price. Great price. $131 for each of our 5 nights. (probably only because we went in January). Great breakfast. Each morning the breakfast room had a great array of fresh food. Servers provide a pot of coffee or tea. A great bar area with very friendly waiter. The location couldn’t be beat. Right across the street from the beautiful Borgese gardens, 10 minutes from the Spanish steps, and walkable to the whole of the old city. The Via Veneto is a high level street in Rome. Expensive shops and restaurants. Eliseo is bookended by some high level hotels. Our room was very clean, great size bathroom. Each day the maid service was fantastic. Great friendly service at the front desk. They helped with questions. All in all, I would go back and I would request room 602. I tested the now famous “staircase” and would be eager to have a room with a view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 day break (10th to 16th Oct 2004) in the Hotel Eliseo, Rome, having been offered this hotel due to a double-booking in the Hotel Fiamma (same hotel chain). Though initially disquieting, the error was a blessing particularly due to the Eliseo's location on the edge of the Borghese gardens... a wonderful parkland area containing Zoo, art gallery, lakes and much more ...very different from the area around the Hotel Fiamma in the area of Termini ! We found the staff diffident but friendly and helpful when asked and when one of was unwell their concern was genuine and appreciated. The buffet breakfast was extensive and the service cheerful and efficient. The views from the 6th floor breakfast room were beautiful and so unexpected. The rooms and bed linen were very clean and the towels were changed every day. The decor is a bit tired in places and the shower a mixer tap style but lots of hot water any time of the day. Location was perfect, close to the Spagna Metro station which could be reached by a long pedestrian underpass which could also be used to get directly to the Spanish Steps (10 mins walk). Good selection of buses from the Borghese gardens ( less than 5 mins away). Very pleasant and safe area to walk about in the evening with a variety of restaurants. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: SableRostron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in June 2004 for a week. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and for that reason alone we will be back. The rooms were average sized but comfortable with a nice en-suite bathroom. The breakfast was amazing with everything from fruit, cereal, yoghurts, croissants to cold meats, bread rolls etc and the view was spectacular. You could see Vatican City while you were eating your breakfast! We can highly recommend this hotel and only 5 mins walk from Via Veneto with Cafe de Paris and Hard Rock Cafe! and 10 mins walk to the Spanish Steps. Definitely the best area of Rome to stay in at a good price.

HotelInfo.Name: Eliseo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Di Porta Pinciana 30 | Centre - Spanish Steps, 00187 Rome, Italy
